In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's an example of a `wrap_string` function in Julia that wraps a string based on a specified `text_width` and adds a new line when the maximum width is exceeded:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width ||
           sum([length(word) for word in wrapped_text]) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_text, "\n")
        end
        push!(wrapped_text, word)
    end

    return join(wrapped_text)
end
```
